Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: Generic wording for those without specific manual wording: "A number of votes have been held on [wording from policies.php]"
Flickr CC Image: Generic option use image of House of Commons
Note: Is MP specific wording OK? Lords pages?

Wording from Policies.php for reference: introducing foundation hospitals',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: An NHS Foundation Trust is part of the NHS in England and Wales given financial and managerial independence from the Department of Health.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: greater regulation of gambling',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: There have been votes in Parliament on a number of aspects of the regulation of gambling. Specific votes have been on the powers of local councils to use planning laws to control the numbers, and locations, of betting shops as well as regulations limiting stakes, and prizes, for gambling machines, and the laws governing the operation of casinos.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: smoking bans',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: Over the years MPs have voted on banning smoking in restaurants, public buildings, pubs, and in cars with children present.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: equal gay rights',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: An MP voting for gay rights would be in favour of homosexual people having the same rights as heterosexuals (including for example the ability to marry, an equal age of consent, and the right to adopt) and for discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation to be illegal.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a wholly elected House of Lords',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The House of Lords is the upper house of the UK Parliament. MPs have voted on moving away from a position where members of the House of Lords are either appointed or have inherited their seats to one where members are elected.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: an investigation into the Iraq war',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: A number of votes were held relating to holding an investigation into the US led invasion of Iraq in 2003.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: replacing Trident with a new nuclear weapons system',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The UK's Trident nuclear weapons system, comprising missile armed submarines, provides a continuous at-sea nuclear deterrent. MPs have voted on if the system should be replaced with a new nuclear deterrent when Trident reaches the end of its lifespan.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a transparent Parliament',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on how transparently Parliament is run, particularly in respect of MPs' expenses.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a referendum on the UK\'s membership of the EU',
Short Title: Referendum on the UK's Membership of the EU
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on if there should be a national referendum on the United Kingdom's continued membership of the European Union.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: measures to prevent climate change',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on targets for reducing carbon dioxide emissions and on increasing the proportion of electricity generated via renewable means as well as on the establishment of a UK Green Investment Bank, to invest in projects which, for example, reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: the Iraq war',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: A number of votes were held on if United Kingdom should take part in the US invasion of Iraq which began in March 2003.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: the hunting ban',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: A vote for a hunting ban is a vote against people being allowed to hunt wild animals (primarily foxes) with hounds.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: introducing ID cards',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs voted on the introduction of a National Identity Register and associated ID Cards to the United Kingdom.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: university tuition fees',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on tuition fees applicable to UK undergraduate students at universities in England. Subjects of specific votes have been on the subjects of introducing fees, increasing to fees, and capping fees.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: Labour\'s anti-terrorism laws',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: An MP voting for Labour's Anti-Terrorism Laws would have been voting for the crime known as "Terrorism" to be treated in a different manner from murder and conspiracy to murder, and for it to have it's own special category meaning the the normal rights not to be detained without charge or trial do not apply.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: more EU integration',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the degree of the UK's integration with the European Union. Specific matters voted on include the UK's opt out from the European Union Police and Criminal Justice Measures and the establishment of a European Union External Action Service.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: allowing ministers to intervene in inquests',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs held a number of votes on the powers of ministers to intervene in inquests. Specific votes were held on questions including if the Secretary of State ought be able to order a coroner's inquest to take place without a jury and if a minister ought be able to  suspend a coroner's inquest.
Search Criteria: Inquest AND ("Coroners and Justice Bill" OR "Counter-Terrorism Bill")

Wording from Policies.php for reference: greater autonomy for schools',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs held a number of votes on giving greater autonomy for schools, including on if more schools should be able to obtain the financial and managerial freedom associated with "academy" status, and the degree of freedom schools ought have in relation to admissions policies.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: removing hereditary peers from the House of Lords',
Short Title: Removing Hereditary Peers from the House of Lords
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the removal of the hereditary peers from the House of Lords

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a more proportional system for electing MPs',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: A number of votes have been held on if the system for electing MPs should be changed so that the number of MPs in Parliament from each party better reflects each party's national share of the vote.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a stricter asylum system',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: An MP voting for a stricter asylum system would be voting to tighten the criteria for granting asylum, to set greater restrictions on activities asylum seekers are permitted to undertake, and to reduce the support provided to those seeking asylum.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: the privatisation of Royal Mail',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs held a number of votes on the privatisation of Royal Mail. Royal Mail was privatised in October 2013.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: encouraging occupational pensions',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: An MP voting to encourage occupational pensions would have been voting to promote workplace pension schemes for example by making them tax efficient and easy for employers to run and for employees to understand.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: increasing the rate of VAT',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the rate at which of Value Added Tax (VAT) is charged.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: an equal number of electors per parliamentary constituency',
Short Title: Equalise Number of Electors Per Parliamentary Constituency
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on equalising the number of people who elect each MP. Specific votes have been held on if there ought be exceptions to rules aimed at equalising the size of constituencies for special cases such as Cornwall and the Isle of Wight.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: capping civil service redundancy payments',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs held a number of votes on introducing a cap on civil service redundancy payments.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: automatic enrolment in occupational pensions',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: An MP voting for automatic enrolment in occupational pensions would have been voting for low-to-mid income earners to be enrolled into pension schemes automatically

Wording from Policies.php for reference: raising England’s undergraduate tuition fee cap to £9,000 per year',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the level of undergraduate tuition fees universities in England are permitted to charge students from the UK.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: fewer MPs in the House of Commons',
Short Title: Number of MPs in the House of Commons
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on reducing the number of MPs in the House of Commons and reviewing the boundaries of parliamentary constituencies.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a reduction in spending on welfare benefits',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the level of spending on welfare benefits. The specific matters voted on include a cap on the overall amount the state spends on welfare each year, the rate of increase of various benefits, and the operation of specific benefits including the reduction in housing benefits for social tenants deemed to have excess bedrooms (described by Labour and others as the "bedroom tax").

Wording from Policies.php for reference: reducing central government funding of local government',
Short Title: Central Government Funding for Local Councils
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the level of funding for local councils.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: reducing housing benefit for social tenants deemed to have excess bedrooms (which Labour describe as the "bedroom tax")',
Short Title: Housing Benefit Reduction For Those Deemed to have Excess Bedrooms
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the introduction, and operation of, a policy to restrict housing benefit for those in social housing deemed to have excess bedrooms. This policy has been called the "Bedroom Tax" by Labour and some commentators.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: paying higher benefits over longer periods for those unable to work due to illness or disability',
Short Title: Benefits for Those Unemployed Due to Illness or Disability
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The amount of welfare benefits paid to those unemployed due to disability or illness has been the subject of a number of votes by MPs.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: raising welfare benefits at least in line with prices',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The level of welfare benefits, and if the rate of increase ought be capped, has been the subject of a number of votes by MPs.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: reforming the NHS so GPs buy services on behalf of their patients',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on if GPs should buy services such as out of hours care, ambulance services and hospital care on behalf of their patients.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: restricting the provision of services to private patients by the NHS',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on restricting the ability of NHS Trusts to generate income from private patients.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: greater restrictions on campaigning by third parties, such as charities, during elections',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the regulation of campaigners who are not standing, or putting up candidates, in general elections.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: reducing the rate of corporation tax',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the rate of tax charged on a company's profits.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: raising the threshold at which people start to pay income tax',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the earnings threshold at which an individual starts to become subject to income tax.
Search Criteria: "income tax personal allowance" OR "personal tax allowance" OR "out of income tax"

Wording from Policies.php for reference: increasing the tax rate applied to income over £150,000',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the rate of the top rate of income tax which applies to income over £150,000.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: ending financial support for some 16-19 year olds in training and further education',
Short Title: Financial Support for 16-19 Year Olds in Education and Training
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on providing financial support for 16-19 year olds in education or training; particularly following the replacement of the education maintenance allowance.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: local councils keeping money raised from taxes on business premises in their areas',
Short Title: Retention of Business Rates by Local Councils
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on reforming the way local councils are funded and switching from central grants to allowing councils to retain a proportion of the business rates generated in their area.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: making local councils responsible for helping those in financial need afford their council tax and reducing the amount spent on such support',
Short Title: Support for Those Unable to Afford Council Tax
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So:
MPs have voted on the question of localising the systems for helping those in financial need pay council 
tax by abolishing the council tax benefit and replacing it with local council tax reduction schemes

Wording from Policies.php for reference: a banker’s bonus tax',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on the level of taxation applied to Banker' Bonuses. In 2009 a one-off 50% tax on on any individual discretionary bonus over £25,000 paid to a banker was levied and there have been a number of votes since on reintroducing such a tax.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: allowing marriage between two people of same sex',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on the question of if same sex couples ought be allowed to marry.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: academy schools',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on the extent of programme under which schools with "Academy Status" are given financial independence and freedom from local authority control. Votes have also been held on what requirements ought be made of Academy Schools in relation to admissions, exclusions and personal, social and health education.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: use of UK military forces in combat operations overseas',
Short Title: Use of UK Military Forces In Combat Abroad
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on the use of UK Military Forces in Afghanistan, Iraq and Syria.
Search Criteria: "combat operations" AND (iraq OR syria OR afghanistan)

Wording from Policies.php for reference: measures to reduce tax avoidance',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on measures, including the introduction of a general anti-abuse rule, aimed at tackling abusive tax avoidance.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: stronger tax incentives for companies to invest in assets',
Short Title: Incentives for Companies to Invest in Assets
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The primary means in which the Government adjusts the incentives for companies to invest in assets (eg. new equipment) is by setting the "annual investment allowance" which the amount spent on investing assets in a year which companies (or self-employed individuals) can deduct from their profits prior to the calculation of corporation tax due.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: slowing the rise in rail fares',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the subject of regulating, and capping, rail fares.
Note: Potentially self explanatory (no need for a sentence)?

Wording from Policies.php for reference: lower taxes on fuel for motor vehicles',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the rates of taxation applying to fuel for motor vehicles.
Note: Potentially self explanatory (no need for a sentence)?

Wording from Policies.php for reference: higher taxes on alcoholic drinks',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the rates of taxation applying to alcoholic drinks.
Note: Potentially self explanatory (no need for a sentence)?

Wording from Policies.php for reference: the introduction of elected Police and Crime Commissioners',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: Elected Police and Crime Commissioners are individuals responsible for the strategic direction and oversight of the police in England and Wales.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: fixed periods between parliamentary elections',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: Fixed Term Parliaments involve holding general elections on a regular basis, for example every five years, with some exceptions permitting early elections. Without Fixed Term Parliaments a party with a majority had significant influence over the timing of a general election.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: higher taxes on plane tickets',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the rates of Air Passenger Duty and the details of which flights it ought apply to.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: selling England’s state owned forests',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The Public Forest Estate in England comprises around 1,500 different woods and forests across England, that is 2% of the land in England and 18% of the woods and forests. MPs have voted on if the estate ought remain publicly-owned and managed by the Forestry Commission or if it should be sold off.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: spending public money to create guaranteed jobs for young people who have spent a long time unemployed',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on if the Government should fund guaranteed jobs for young people.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: laws to promote equality and human rights',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the subject of where prejudice or discrimination should be made illegal and where exceptions should be made to permit otherwise illegal discrimination. MPs have also voted on the degree to which "human rights" are protected.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: financial incentives for low carbon emission electricity generation methods',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: There have been a number of votes by MPs relating to finanical incentives designed to encourage electricity generation via methods which involve low levels of carbon emissions. Matters voted on include subsidies for renewable energy generation and on limiting carbon dioxide emissions from power stations.
Flickr CC Image Attribution Name: Department of Energy and Climate Change

Wording from Policies.php for reference: requiring pub companies to offer pub landlords rent-only leases',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on the question of if pub companies should be required to offer their tenants an option to rent the premises with no requirement to buy beer, and other supplies, from the pub company.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: strengthening the Military Covenant',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: The armed forces covenant sets out the relationship between the nation, the government and the armed forces. It recognises that the whole nation, has a moral obligation to members of the armed forces and their families, and it establishes how they should expect to be treated. MPs have voted on the question of to what extent should there be special provisions for current, and former, service personnel in relation to public services in areas such as healthcare, education and housing.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: restricting the scope of legal aid',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on the subject of eligibility for legal aid. Matters which have been voted on include means testing, if aid should be generally restricted to those residing in the UK, and which legal services should be funded by legal aid.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: transferring more powers to the Welsh Assembly',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on devolving powers to the Welsh Assembly. Specific subjects of these votes have ranged from giving the Welsh Assembly the ability to raise taxes to devolving powers and responsibility relating to the provision of water in Wales.
Search Criteria: "welsh devolution" OR "powers to wales" OR "powers to welsh government" OR "powers to welsh parliament"

Wording from Policies.php for reference: transferring more powers to the Scottish Parliament',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have held a number of votes on devolving powers to the Scottish Parliament. Specific subjects of these votes have ranged from giving the Scottish Parliament the ability to raise taxes to devolving powers and responsibility relating to the Maritime and Coastguard Agency in Scotland.
Search Criteria: "scottish devolution" OR "powers to scotland" OR "powers to scottish government" OR "powers to scottish parliament"

Wording from Policies.php for reference: culling badgers to tackle bovine tuberculosis',
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on if badgers ought be culled in an effort to control bovine tuberculosis.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: an annual tax on the value of expensive homes (popularly known as a mansion tax)',
Short Title: Tax on Value of Expensive Homes
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So:
MPs have voted on the inroduction of a new property tax on expensive homes. Such a tax, popularly dubbed a "mansion tax", would introduce a requirement for those with residential properties worth over a certain 
amount to pay a fraction of the property's value (or a fraction of its 
value over a certain amount) to the Government each year.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: allowing employees to exchange some employment rights for shares in the company they work for'
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on the introduction of the employee shareholder scheme which is an employee status obtained when an employee is given shares worth at least £2,000 in return for which the employer is permitted not to extend unfair dismissal rights, rights to statutory redundancy pay and other employment rights to the employee.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: powers for local councils'
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs often vote on the extent of powers devolved to local government on a range of matters from planning to the regulation of street trading.

Wording from Policies.php for reference: allowing national security sensitive evidence to be put before courts in secret sessions'
Policy Page Introduction Sentence or So: MPs have voted on if there should be a mechanism for material deemed national security sensitive to be made available to a civil court and a special advocate but not parties to the case. The mechanism is called the "closed material procedure".
